alert.note: Alert for Northwest St. Tammany; Southern Tangipahoa (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 9:58AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central St. Tammany and southern Tangipahoa Parishes through 1030 AM CST... At 957 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hammond, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Covington, Ponchatoula, Folsom, Robert and Natalbany. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 35 and 57. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 22 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
